name: Karen Blixen Camp

reviews.title: Good accomodation- very poor food
reviews.text: Everything was fine,safari guide, game drives , tent -phantastic - except the food!! Unbeliefable . Very poor cooking - not acceptablefor such a camp. Even the toast - horrible.Therefore only three stars.

If you ever want to have an extraordinary vacation experience with luxury tenting, fantastic food, an out-of-your-dreams scienary with a friendly staff with a great hospitality - visit Karen Blixen Camp! We spent three days with amazing Game Drives with faboulus guiding from Nicloas and Peter in Masai Mara Reserve and got to see the Big Five in addition to all kind of other African animals. We saw approxiamtely 1.8 mill wildbeests and 500 000 zebras in the Great Migration, and the start of the Big Crossing with lots of crocodilles in the rives. It cannot be described - it has to be seen. We also had our 15 years anniversary with a bush dinner - a spectacular dinner experience in the bush with Masai warriors as guards from the wild animals. We really hope we can go back!
reviews.title: The most memorable vacation ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our experiences at the KBC was exceptional. From the moment we arrives we were greeted with such hospitality and luxury. Our tent was beautifully furnished, comfortable,and a welcome home in the bush. The staff was wonderful, the food was great, and the safari's were divine! Our guides Jackson and Branice were fabulous, and tailored our safari experience to our preferences.We took a hot air balloon ride followed by a champagne brunch that was truly memorable. We also enjoyed a evening dinner in the bush complete with light lanterns, a fire and traditional Kenyan bbq. My husband and I have traveled all over the world and this was one of the best trips we had ever taken. We saw elephant carvans, lions, the great migration, cheetah's with cubs, and every animal in the Mara. Within 30 minutes of arriving in camp we saw an elephant come to the river. The hippo family that lives there was enjoyable to watch. We selected this camp because of their ecofriendly approach to tourism, including solar showers, cooking and computer classes for staff and Masai. We planted trees on our last day and visited the gardens, garage, laundry and kitchens. We didn't want to leave, but certainly would recommend this camp to anyone who is looking for a wonderful safari experience that mixes wildlife, luxury, adventure, ecotourism, gourmet meals, great spa services into a single experience. While this safari was expensive, it was worth every penny...I'd do it all over again! Kudos to the staff at KBC for the trip of a lifetime...we will return.
reviews.title: Karen Blixen Camp in Masai Mara Kenya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited in June with my fiancee and stayed two nights (wish it was longer!). The staff, the management, the food, the ambience, the tented rooms and the overall atmosphere of the place were all lovely. We were in rainly season and the safari drivers made a real effort to hunt out the animals we wanted to see, despite some pretty hefty downpours. I would absolutely recommend for anyone to stay here, particularly to experience the eco-lodge aspects, and the resident hippos!
reviews.title: Really wonderful place

reviews.text: I visited Karen Blixen Camp (KBC) in June 2012 as part of an 11-day photo safari trip in Kenya & Tanzania. We visited 5 different park areas, with the Masai Mara/ Mara North Conservancy as our final park. Our 3 night stay here at KBC was the perfect "crown jewel" in our safari experience. We were greeted by Martin, the camp's wonderful Danish co-owner (opened in 2007) and equally friendly & gracious asst. manager, Sharon. The camp evokes peace and casual elegance with its beautiful setting on the Mara River, complete with a resident pod of hippos, and lovely public areas (dining room, lounge and bar). My large "tented camp" room was heavenly - with a spacious wooden deck with river views, nice furniture, a large bathroom and "open air" shower. The whole camp evoked a feeling of "Out of Africa" which was clearly their intent and I loved their "true" eco-responsible focus (both in how they built the camp, such as using only solar power and how they work with and employ the local Masai villagers). The food was gourmet and all of the camp staff were great. KBC's safari jeeps (6 passenger) and driver guides were excellent. Our group enjoyed a sunrise balloon ride over the Masai Mara (wonderful, including the post-ride champagne breakfast) and some people made a visit to a local Masai village to experience the Masai's very different and fascinating culture. Our short time at Karen Blixen passed much too quickly but my vivid memories of this lovely place will always remain.
reviews.title: The Perfect Safari Camp Experience

reviews.text: Please re-read the title of this review, as this is not a 5-star hotel, but a 5-star experience. This is a critical distinction that must be understood. At Karen Blixen, one is housed in tent cabins that are the size of small house, well-furnished and decorated, with an outside shower area the size of a typical American bedroom. Even with all the physical comforts, its the service that creates the 5-star experience, from the cabin steward who takes care of your cabin from morning to evening turndown, to the dining room staff who are gracious and solicitous, to the reception staff who provide suggestions to make your stay a true adventure, to the fully trained guides who are fully knowledgable concerning the Maasai Mara wildlife - all of these people are what makes Karen Blixen an "Exquisite Experience." Others have written of the animals around the Camp grounds, but a must-do is the Game Walk offered for only $30. This walk consists of being driven to a an area of the Mara where a guest can walk the Land among whatever animals are nearby, but not the Big 5 which could be dangerous. I was accompanied by a guide, a guard, plus a driver who waits in the distance just in I became tired. I walked near groups of giraffes, antelope, wart hog, hyena, zebra. And, when a report of a cheetah kill was received by the driver, he picked us all up and took us to the kill, and then through a herd of elephant and pride of lion. The guide educated me about animal tracks and scat during the walk and was fully versed in both scientific and anecdotal information about both the animal and plant life of the Mara. I stayed an KBC through a tour, so I don't know how much it cost, but it certainly was an experience of a lifetime.
reviews.title: Exquisite Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this camp through Real Africa, their service (Paul Hickey-Fry) was faultless. Travel arrangements worked without a hitch. We were welcomed by our driver Jacob and spotter Charles. I would ask for them by name if you go because they seem to be able to find all of the game and get you into a good position for photos. Mark (camp manager) welcomed us to the camp and showed us round he is a really nice man and made sure that everything went smoothly. The camp is beautiful and the food is excellent especially as my wife who is vegetarian was catered for at every meal. The camp is on the Mara River and the Hippo pool is opposite the restaurant. This makes the came very special as you can watch game all day without moving from your table if you wish. We did a balloon safari which was superb I will never forget it.
reviews.title: Special Holiday

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this fantastic camp. I was sick on the day of arrival (jumping with the Masais didn't help), but the staff got me back on track with a bitter/club soda cocktail and plain rice, so that I could enjoy the rest of the stay and all the fantastic safaris.
reviews.title: A great welcoming camp

reviews.text: Our safari guides, Jacob and Francis, were excellent spotters and led us to the big 5 including a lion family with 8 cubs, cheetah and everything else you'd want to see on a safari.
reviews.title: Karen Blixen Camp - Perfect Home Base for Our Safari

reviews.text: Comfortable camp with all the amenities you can ask for, along the Mara river. They have a bunch of resident hippos and crocs across the river, and you have giraffes, zebras, warthogs, jackals, elephants and, I am told, an occasional leopard visiting in the evenings. So you can get a fair bit of animal watching done sipping your favorite drink at the hotel (beer and house wine were part of our package - you can pay a premium to get all drinks included).
reviews.title: Fantastic experience at a great location in the Mara

reviews.text: Tents are large and comfortable with a nice open air shower, and the staff are friendly and happy to help. A good sleep is all but guaranteed after a long safari amidst the sound of the flowing river and honking hippos. Free Wifi (though slow and spotty) available at the reception, which I considered a bonus.
reviews.title: Absolutely Magic

reviews.text: Unlimited game drives are included in your package. We were in a group of 9 so we got two vehicles. Our drivers/guides Lorna and Nicholas were excellent, and they have a good radio network with other guides to alert each other to spottings. The first day we went on an evening ride and spotted a leopard, and a pride of lions munching away on a baby deer right next to our jeep. A tad scary - we could hear the big lioness crunching away on the bones. And we knew this wasn't enough food for the whole pride so couldn't help wondering if one of us were next!
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.text: The next day was a full day drive to the Mara Reserve where we saw the migration with thousands of wildebeest and zebras crossing the river (some of which were gobbled up by waiting crocs), and also a leopard which couldn't resist picking an easy kill from the passing herd.
reviews.title: Magical place

aka: Karen Blixen Camp Hotel Maasai Mara National Reserve
description: Karen Blixen Camp in the Masai Mara offers an authentic ’yesteryear’ experience for visitors wishing to gain that little extra from their safari. Set on the bank of the Mara River; the location is spectacular. Throughout the day elephants, giraffes, zebras and impalas come for a drink while a large hippo pod rest lazily in the river. The Camp gives a feeling of the early 1920’s era with beautiful and comfortable furniture.
